intro: Mesembryanthemum salmii, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically blooms in summer, producing bright yellow or orange flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its thick, waxy leaves help it retain moisture in arid environments, making it well adapted to dry climates. Mesembryanthemum salmii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant appearance and low maintenance requirements.
